Methods

Circle(Int32, Boolean)

Draws a circle around the cursor's position with a provided radius

Declaration
public void Circle(int radius, bool filled)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 radius

Radius of the circle to be drawn
System.Boolean filled

Determines if the circle should be filled in or just an outline
Examples

Drawing a circle with a radius of 50 

Circle(50,false);
Exceptions
Type Condition
BOOSE.CanvasException

Clear()

Wipes the canvas clean and returns it to it's original state

Declaration
public void Clear()

Draws a straight line from the cursors current position to the provided position

Type Name Description
System.Int32 toX

The destination pixel on the X axis
System.Int32 toY

The destination pixel on the Y axis

Declaration
public object getBitmap()
Returns
Type Description
System.Object

The bitmap with all the drawings and edits

MoveTo(Int32, Int32)

Moves the cursor from the current position to the provided position without drawing a line

Declaration
public void MoveTo(int x, int y)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 x

The destination pixel on the X axis
System.Int32 y

The destination pixel on the Y axis
Exceptions
Type Condition
BOOSE.CanvasException

Rect(Int32, Int32, Boolean)

Draws a rectangle from the cursor's position using the provided width and height The rectangle's top-left edge will be the cursors position

Declaration
public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 width

The width of the new rectangle
System.Int32 height

The height of the new rectangle
System.Boolean filled

Determines if the rectangle should be filled or just outlined
Examples

Drawing an outline rectangle with a width of 150 and a height of 75 

Rect(150,75,false);
Exceptions
Type Condition
BOOSE.CanvasException

Will return a CanvasException if either width or height is negative.

Reset()

Resets the position of the cursor

Declaration
public void Reset()

Set(Int32, Int32)

Changes the size of the canvas to the given resolution

Declaration
public void Set(int xsize, int ysize)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 xsize

The new number of horizontal pixels
System.Int32 ysize

The new number of vertical pixels

SetColour(Int32, Int32, Int32)

Changes the colour of the pen using 3 0-255 integers

Declaration
public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 red

Determines the red hex value
System.Int32 green

Determines the green hex value
System.Int32 blue

Determines the blue hex value
Examples

To change the colour to blue 

SetColour(0,0,255);


To change to green 
SetColour(0,255,0);
Exceptions
Type Condition
BOOSE.CanvasException

Will return CanvasException if any values are not within 0-255

Tri(Int32, Int32)

Draws a triangle with the pen position at the center of the triangle Top and base of the triangle will be half of the heigh above and below the pen position

Declaration
public void Tri(int width, int height)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 width

The width of the base of the triangle
System.Int32 height

The height of the triangle
Exceptions
Type Condition
BOOSE.CanvasException

Will return a CanvasException if values are not positive

WriteText(String)

Takes text input by the user and writes it to the canvas

Declaration
public void WriteText(string text)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String text

Text to be drawn onto the canvas
Exceptions
Type Condition
BOOSE.CanvasException

Will return CanvasException if there is no text
